item.title: Rotten gatepost so gate hanging at an angle and will collapse, 19th January
item.description:
Footpath from church road Woolstone down to Turn brook. The gate is required because many walkers with children use the path and the gate prevents children running into the road heavily used by farm and other traffic.PathAOX/18/1

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ivy damaging large tree, 19th January
item.description:
Ivy is growing high up into the crown of a tree and could damage a well established large tree on a roundabout. The whole roundabout could do with tidying up as it is overgrown.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Drug use & paraphernalia, 19th January
item.description:
Sunday 19th @ 2:30am collection of youths sat, took ‘nos’ dumped the 12 large tubes and left the area. There is now litter / drug paraphernalia needing to be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stilchester Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Damaged bollard causing a significant amount of tarmac to be lifted, 19th January
item.description:
The bollard outside 1st Prestbury scout group has been knocked over causing the tarmac of over 1m square to be lifted a couple of inches. The location is opposite the scout group entrance and opposite the Royal Oak pub. The damage has been done today (19th Jan) As this is used for the entrance to the scout group and a trip hazard in the dark a couple of cones from the scout group have been placed by the damage until better signage can be placed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, The Burgage, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: County council property abandoned in public space, 19th January
item.description:
After repairing a manhole cover promptly, the barriers used for the work have not been cleared away. Public space should not be used as a storage area for county council equipment. Please collect the barriers which have been here since October 2024.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pinemount Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole - excessive noise, 18th January
item.description:
Just east of the Green Lane junction the manhole (Severn Trent) is making excessive noise when driven over. This is becoming unbearable and sounds as loud as a gunshot. We are noticing it more as it is loud and irregular, but at very short intervals.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree came down in high winds around Christmas 2024!, 18th January
item.description:
Tree fallen across pavement. Completely obstructing pavement since end December 2024. Unsafe for pedestrians as unable to use pavement and have to step into busy main road to get by. Please advise who is going to fix this - Gloucestershire Highways or Cheltenham Borough Council or are they too busy arguing whose responsibility it is to fix it instead of caring about safety of pedestrians?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement
